result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Bernhardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zachary Bernhardt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zachary Bernhardt was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees. 
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. May not have contact with Stephanie B except while Stephanie B is at the hospital, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the Defendant's probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary Bernhardt

records.addlTxt: Cash bond applied; partial refund;  sg /mg   ck#22CH090854
Counts 1 & 3 dismissed on State's motion
of DNA Collection at Conviction
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

2:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Zachary Bernhardt in court.  Attorney David Rudolph Berman in court for Zachary Bernhardt. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Matter is resolved. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 2; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 1 & 3 are dismissed. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions. No contact w/ S.B. (except for as listed on the Conditions of Probation form) Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. No sentence credit. Court costs and DNA surcharge ordered. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and notice given to def. in court. Appeals rights given.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Berman.  Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Berman's bond motion. Victim address court. Court denies bond motion. STC set to 10/03/22 at 2:00.
The costs restitution and other fees come out first before the payment
re: Judicial Rotation
From Court re: rotation.
Pre-trial conference on August 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant, Zachary Bernhardt, appeared with Attorney David Rudolph Berman.    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued as previously set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:30 am. Bond continued with same conditions as previously set.
Correspondence received from Atty Berman requests prelim be moved to a waiver of prelim at 1PM on 6/8/22.  Court Commissioner has approved the request.
